item.title: Rare flight for the biggest plane in the world
item.description:
The undisputed superstar of the skies -- the biggest airplane in the world -- is taking flight on a rare delivery mission across three continents.

Sponsored:
Drivers Will Be Furious When This Finally Happens
If you drive less than 50 miles a day, this new rule will shock you.
item.ExtractedText: 1 of 8 8 photos: World's biggest plane Big one – Only one of these planes exists. There is no other. For many enthusiasts, its size and its singular, unique status makes the An-225 Mriya the king of the aviation world. Hide Caption 2 of 8 8 photos: World's biggest plane Nose entry – Cargo is loaded through the plane's nose. On its current mission, Mriya is transporting a giant Czech-made electric generator from Prague across three continents to Perth, Australia. Mriya's massive cargo hold is 141 feet (43 meters) long. That's longer than the Wright Brothers' historic flight in 1903. Hide Caption 3 of 8 8 photos: World's biggest plane Massive power – The Mirya has been tasked with delivering a generator that weighs more than 100 tons. It was manufactured by the Brush Sem engineering company in Plzen, Czech Republic, for Australian aluminum producer Worstely Alumina. Hide Caption 4 of 8 8 photos: World's biggest plane See four, raise two – We live in an age when most airliners are powered by two or four jet engines. This monster has six. Hide Caption 5 of 8 8 photos: World's biggest plane Monster wingspan – Its wingspan measures 290 feet (88 meters). That's longer than five 53-foot semi-truck trailers set end-to-end. Hide Caption 6 of 8 8 photos: World's biggest plane Big lift – The An-225's maximum total weight at takeoff including cargo: 640 tons. That's more than twice as heavy as the Statue of Liberty. Hide Caption 7 of 8 8 photos: World's biggest plane World tour – Mriya has scheduled stops in Turkmenistan, India and Malaysia before arriving this weekend in Perth, where thousands of fans are expected to greet the plane and its six-member crew, according to the Antonov Company . Hide Caption
